intro: Trigonostemon bulusanensis, commonly known as the Bulusan mountain glorybower, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its striking yellow flowers with red bracts. The plant typically grows in montane forests and has a shrub-like structure with lance-shaped leaves. Its botanical features include opposite leaf arrangement and a unique floral structure that attracts pollinators. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
